tweets.text:
Please don‚Äôt feed a festive #fatberg when cooking your #ChristmasDinner dinner this year!

Don‚Äôt pour fats, oils, grease down the sink as this can lead to a build up of #fatbergs, causing blockages & pollution.
 
Leave them to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. https://t.co/C6irZdbKml

tweets.text:
For every one million turkeys we cook, around 250 tonnes of fats could be poured down the sink. 

Leftover cooking fats can harden in cold pipes and create blockages, increasing the risk of sewer flooding.  

Instead leave to cool, then scrape into the bin. https://t.co/x4S4yCfeUE

tweets.text:
Please stay away from #flood water and flooded rivers, submerged paths can hide unknown hazards. Just a few inches of flowing water can sweep you off your feet. 

#Staysafe https://t.co/ST031AWRon

Hotspot checks this morning at #Studley, #KingsCoughton & #Alcester. We‚Äôre going to be across the patch today clearing screens and checking hotspots #flood @EnvAgencyMids @StratfordDC @AlcesterTown https://t.co/s2s5beaRmR

I‚Äôve been on-site with @CanalRiverTrust overnight where the @EnvAgencyYNE are supporting #CRT in their response to a canal breach.

We‚Äôve deployed 3 x #EA mobile #HighVolumePumps as part of the multi-agency response and will be reviewing further tactical options today. https://t.co/YNTWy7kupc
@Kenarf @MerryAlbright @TheMontyDon @timthefruit @NFUtweets @EnvAgency As a farmer I try to make sure we have no bare soil over the winter. Entirely preventable.

tweets.text: Amazing but concerning to see the ground full and saturated soils near Shrewsbury and significant surface run-off. More rain expected today and flood alerts across Shropshire. #Weather #floods #WinterSolstice @EnvAgency @LYR_Shropshire #rain #catchment #mondaythoughts https://t.co/XAzRp6008I
@BBCWomansHour @DrCobbold Fantastic to hear this example of climate adaptation, especially as my wife Samina Khan led the project for @EnvAgencySE
@timthefruit @NFUtweets Wellington Brook that runs into the Lugg just a short distance downstream. Was this colour all weekend. @EnvAgency https://t.co/B4zRArkZRD

Sorry but I disagree. @EnvAgency have failed despite significantly increased funding to tackle #wastecrime. They have an obsession with ‚Äòillegal sites‚Äô while other forms of illegality such as fly tipping continue to grow. https://t.co/KGexQxrs0v

Our experts help deliver academic teaching for the MSc programme (and also for the #BSc and #Foundation courses), working in partnership with @BrunelFlood_Eng  and the @EnvAgency. Students usually take part in a summer school using our world-class facilities @howberypark. https://t.co/skJMHt62LY

urls.title: Flood and Coastal Engineering | Brunel University London
urls.description: This exciting new funded programme, developed in partnership with the Environment Agency will equip you with the knowledge you need for a successful career in flood risk management.

tweets.text:
Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/KBWORYDPJN

@bentheoandrews @TheMontyDon @timthefruit @NFUtweets @EnvAgency Oh completely agree however the post is meant to imply that this is caused by the work carried out upstream in the main river.

@puncherton @TheMontyDon @timthefruit @NFUtweets @EnvAgency Just another example of avoidable soil erosion that is adding towards Lugg pollution and damaging farmland. As farmers it‚Äôs our biggest asset. Baffles me why anyone would want to see it wash down a river.

tweets.text:
EDF & @BorisJohnson need to listen to @EnvAgency's @EmmaHowardBoyd: ‚Äúwe cannot win a war against water by building away climate change with infinitely high flood defences" EDF have already raised planned Sizewell C sea wall to 14m from 10.2m 6mths earlier
https://t.co/2zxtkCfdCS https://t.co/vRXRrUWMp6
@bentheoandrews @TheMontyDon @timthefruit @NFUtweets @EnvAgency How would a tributary be affected...it doesn't work that way.

A lot of beach has disappeared! Exposes idiocy of building 2 new nuclear reactors just up the coast at Sizewell
In just 6mths EDF have suggested raising the sea wall from 10.2m in DCO to 14m in 5th consultation Who will protect us from this folly for 200yrs @The_ONR @EnvAgency ? https://t.co/yhW47IJJta

üåä @DrCobbold co-founded the Manhood Peninsula Partnership which resulted in the protection of 300 hectares of important and biodiverse habitats from flooding üåø She's No. 10 on the #WHPowerList and joins Jane today https://t.co/JBJT3vnnt7 https://t.co/1FBUsaTK7W

@IDBYorkshire @EnvAgencyYNE  @East_Riding @Humberbeat are currently assisting @CanalRiverTrust with an incident at East Cowick. Temporary works to the local land drainage system have been carried out in order to reduce flood risk.

Important advice from colleagues in @EnvAgency who are on scene with us in the area. @HumbersideFire have deployed a drone with night vision & recording capability to help monitor the situation. @BBCPaulMurphy Stay safe everyone https://t.co/xDQJMV7O1K
Flood warnings are now in place for the River Ouse in York and Naburn Lock. Check if you‚Äôre at risk and what to do to prepare for a flood. https://t.co/jgw6eA8sOT
@CFOBlacksell @AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @CanalRiverTrust @HumbersideFire @OHDB_ @MoretonBack1 Thanks! Aire & Calder?

@MerryAlbright @bentheoandrews @TheMontyDon @timthefruit @NFUtweets @EnvAgency . This (without the fertilisers) is a natural process. It may conflict with what we want, but we have to work to mitigate it.
